Title.evidence: Tailoring Biliopancreatic Limb Length in One Anastomosis Gastric Bypass: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Participants.evidence: eligible patients aged 18-65 years, meeting IFSO criteria for metabolic bariatric surgery, were randomised intraoperatively

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received a tailored BP limb based on TSBL, while the control group received a standard 150 cm BP limb.

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate whether tailoring the biliopancreatic (BP) limb length based on total small bowel length (TSBL) results in superior outcomes compared to a fixed 150 cm BP limb in one anastomosis gastric bypass (OAGB).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was percentage total weight loss (%TWL) at 5 years, with a predefined 1-year analysis.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation used a sealed envelope method with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, research team, and care providers were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between September 2020 and August 2022, 212 patients were randomised: 105 to the standard group and 107 to the tailored group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: At 1 year, the mean %TWL was 32.8% in the standard group and 33.1% in the tailored group (P = 0.787).

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 1 year, the mean %TWL was 32.8% in the standard group and 33.1% in the tailored group (P = 0.787).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild and occurred in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: Dutch Trial Register, NL7945.
